content: of the brim tie off and weave in ends hat band 1 with mc and 4 5mm hook chain 5 2 single_crochet in second chain from hook and all the way across 4sts chain 1 turn 3 single_crochet 4 ch1 turn x74 4 single_crochet 4 tie off 5 join mc yarn at either end of band at the second stitch in leaving first stitch unworked single_crochet 2 leave remaining stitch unworked chain 1 turn 6 single_crochet 2 chain 1 turn x4 7 2sc in first stitch 2sc in last stitch chain 1 turn 8 single_crochet 4 ch1 turn x3 9 2sctog 2sctog chain 1 turn 10 single_crochet 2 chain 1 turn 11 2sctog tie off 12 join mc at end of hatband you haven t worked yet at the second stitch in leaving first stitch unworked single_crochet 2 leave remaining stitch unworked chain 1 turn 13 single_crochet 2 chain 1 turn x4 14 2 single_crochet in first st 2 single_crochet in last stitch chain 1 turn 15 single_crochet 4 chain 1 turn x3 16 2sctog 2sctog chain 1 turn 17 single_crochet 2 ch1 turn 18 2sctog tie off finishing single_crochet all the way around the border of the hat band including the pointy bits on the ends weave in ends either crochet 2 red buttons and one green button crochet around 3 buttons using red and green yarn or buy 2 red and 1 green premade buttons of your choice wrap hat band around hat centering the crossed part where it should be according the inspiration for the hat anchor the hat band by sewing it to the hat at the crossed part if it doesn t anchor properly add a few stitches on the opposite side of the hat from the crossed part through the hat band and into the hat sew the buttons on and block the hat if necessary after weaving in any remaining ends this pattern is copyright 2008 by nichole m verville this pattern is not to be sold except with permission from me you may sell the finished product of this pattern as long as i am credited for the pattern you may use this pattern for personal use as long as i am credited for the pattern
